00001 /** \file
00002  * \brief Processing Counter
00003  *
00004  * See Copyright Notice in im_lib.h
00005  */
00006 
00007 #ifndef __IM_COUNTER_H
00008 #define __IM_COUNTER_H
00009 
00010 #if     defined(__cplusplus)
00011 extern "C" {
00012 #endif
00013 
00014 
00015 /** \defgroup counter Counter 
00016  * \par
00017  * Used to notify the application that a step in the loading, saving or processing operation has been performed.
00018  * \par
00019  * See \ref im_counter.h
00020  * \ingroup util */
00021 
00022 /** Counter callback, informs the progress of the operation to the client. \n
00023  * Text contains a constant string that is NULL during normal counting, a title in the begining of a sequence 
00024  * and a message in the begining of a count.
00025  * Counter id identifies diferrent counters. \n
00026  * Progress in a count reports a value from 0 to 1000. 
00027  * If -1 indicates the start of a sequence of operations, 1001 ends the sequence. \n
00028  * If returns 0 the client should abort the operation. \n
00029  * If the counter is aborted, the callback will be called one last time at 1001.
00030  * \ingroup counter */
00031 typedef int (*imCounterCallback)(int counter, void* user_data, const char* text, int progress);
00032 
00033 /** Changes the counter callback. Returns old callback. \n
00034  * User data is changed only if not NULL.
00035  * \ingroup counter */
00036 imCounterCallback imCounterSetCallback(void* user_data, imCounterCallback counter_func);
00037 
00038 /** Returns true if the counter callback is set.
00039  * When the callback is NULL the counter is inactive and all functions do nothing.
00040  * \ingroup counter */
00041 int imCounterHasCallback(void);
00042 
00043 /** Begins a new count, or a partial-count in a sequence. \n
00044  * Calls the callback with "-1" and text=title, if it is at the top level. \n     
00045  * This is to be used by the operations. Returns a counter Id.
00046  * \ingroup counter */
00047 int imCounterBegin(const char* title);
00048 
00049 /** Ends a count, or a partial-count in a sequence. \n
00050  * Calls the callback with "1001", text=null, and releases the counter if it is at top level count. \n
00051  * \ingroup counter */
00052 void imCounterEnd(int counter);
00053 
00054 /** Increments a count. Must set the total first. \n
00055  * Calls the callback, text=message if it is the first increment for the count. \n
00056  * Returns 0 if the callback aborted, 1 if returns normally.
00057  * \ingroup counter */
00058 int imCounterInc(int counter);
00059 
00060 /** Set a specific count. Must set the total first. \n
00061  * Calls the callback, text=message if it is the first increment for the count. \n
00062  * Returns 0 if the callback aborted, 1 if returns normally.
00063  * \ingroup counter */
00064 int imCounterIncTo(int counter, int count);
00065 
00066 /** Sets the total increments of a count.
00067  * \ingroup counter */
00068 void imCounterTotal(int counter, int total, const char* message);
00069 
00070 /** Sets an additional user data in the counter.
00071  * Used to save the lock in multi-threaded configurations.
00072  * \ingroup counter */
00073 void* imCounterGetUserData(int counter);
00074 
00075 /** Returns the additional user data in the counter.
00076  * \ingroup counter */
00077 void imCounterSetUserData(int counter, void* userdata);
00078 
00079 
00080 #if defined(__cplusplus)
00081 }
00082 #endif
00083 
00084 #endif
